content.title: Pension Scheme for Transgender
content.department: Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education
content.details: Launched on 1st August 2015, the scheme 'Pension Scheme for Transgender' provides financial assistance of ₹2,000/- to the transgender residents of Tripura who have no source of income.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Tripura.
content.application_process: Offline. The applications would be invited from the eligible candidates by giving wide publicity through print media and electronic media.
documents_required: Medical Certificate (Issued by Govt. Medical Officer not below the rank of Tripura health service Grade IV).

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the Pension Scheme for Transgender?
faqs.answer: Individuals identified as transgender residing in Tripura without a source of income are eligible.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for applicants?
faqs.answer: No, applicants of all ages are eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is income status a criterion for eligibility?
faqs.answer: No, both APL (Above Poverty Line) and BPL (Below Poverty Line) individuals can apply.

faqs.question: How much pension is provided under the scheme?
When was the scheme implemented?
faqs.answer: The scheme was implemented on 1st August 2015.

faqs.question: How are beneficiaries selected?
faqs.answer: Applications are invited through wide media coverage and consultation with local authorities.

faqs.question: Who sanctions the pension?
faqs.answer: Child Development Project Officers (CDPOs) sanction the pension to eligible cases.

faqs.question: Is there a monitoring mechanism for the scheme's implementation?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department monitors the progress and submits monthly reports to the government.

faqs.question: Can transgender individuals from outside Tripura apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only residents of Tripura are eligible.

faqs.question: Can transgender individuals with some income source still apply?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is for those without any source of income.

faqs.question: Are transgender individuals of all gender identities eligible?
faqs.answer: Yes, individuals identifying as transgender, irrespective of gender identity, can apply.

faqs.question: What documentation is required during application?
faqs.answer: A medical certificate from a Tripura health service Grade IV officer is mandatory.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee?
faqs.answer: No, there is no application fee for the Pension Scheme for Transgender.

faqs.question: How is the application process for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The application process involves submitting a duly filled application form along with required documents to the office of the Child Development Project Officer (CDPO) of the concerned area.
